name: PregnancyLabsBloodSerumPlasmaUrine
title: Pregnancy Labs, Blood/Serum/Plasma/Urine
description:
This value set can be used for identifying patients who have undergone pregnancy testing or hCG level monitoring.
It can be helpful for tracking trends in pregnancy testing practices and monitoring hCG levels during prenatal care.
It can be used for research on the use of hCG testing in various pregnancy-related contexts.
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This value set focuses on laboratory tests performed on blood, serum, plasma, and urine samples to assess pregnancy status and monitor its health. It encompasses various tests that measure the levels of human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), a hormone produced during pregnancy.),(Data Element Scope: This data element captures a category of laboratory tests relevant to pregnancy. It includes various hCG assays performed on different sample types (blood/serum/plasma/urine) and provides a starting point for further analysis.),(Inclusion Criteria: hCG assays performed on different sample types (blood/serum/plasma/urine) for pregnancy testing),(Exclusion Criteria: This value set focuses solely on hCG testing and does not capture other laboratory tests relevant to pregnancy (e.g., complete blood count, blood type, or prenatal screening tests).)
